Class Area

java.lang.Object
Area
public class Area extends Object
This class represents an area in the game where the player can move and interact with creatures. It maintains the state of the area, including dimensions, the current state of the board, and the player's position.

    • Area

      public Area(String strNumArea) throws IOException
      This constructor initializes a new area with a given number.
      Parameters:
      strNumArea - The number of the area.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error reading the area dimensions or creature data.

  • Method Details

    • printArea

      public void printArea()
      This method prints the current state of the area to the console.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(Inventory CPlayerInventory, int nPlayerMove, int nAreaNum, Sound CSound) throws IOException
      This method moves the player in the area according to a given move and potentially triggers a battle with a creature.
      Parameters:
      CPlayerInventory - The player's inventory.
      nPlayerMove - The move to make (1: UP, 2: DOWN, 3: LEFT, 4: RIGHT).
      nAreaNum - The number assigned to the area
      CSound - The sound utility class to play sounds
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error during the battle phase.

    • battlePhase

      public void battlePhase(Inventory CPlayerInventory, String strCreature, Sound CSound) throws IOException
      This method handles the battle phase when a creature is encountered. It implements the logic for the player's actions, including attacking, swapping creatures, catching creatures, and running away. It also handles the creature's health, the possibility of the creature fleeing, and the end of the battle phase.
      Parameters:
      CPlayerInventory - The player's inventory.
      strCreature - The name of the encountered creature.
      CSound - The sound object used for playing sounds during the battle.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error during the battle phase.

    • setNumArea

      public void setNumArea(String strNumArea)
      This method sets the number of the area.
      Parameters:
      strNumArea - The number to set for the area.

    • getNumArea

      public String getNumArea()
      This method gets the number of the area.

      The number of the area.

    • setDimensions

      public void setDimensions() throws IOException
      This method sets the dimensions of the area based on the area number.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error reading the dimensions file.

    • getDimensions

      public ArrayList<Integer> getDimensions()
      This method gets the dimensions of the area.
      Returns:
      The dimensions of the area.
